description.narrative:
OXFAM NOVIB IMPACT AND LONG-TERM OUTCOME
Burundian producer organizations, their national forum (FOPABU) and CSOs gain a strong capacity to develop and advance propositions and influence local and regional public and private sector policies, providing enabling environment to gain equitable access to fertilizer inputs, land, and credit for sustainable agriculture livelihoods benefiting small food producer families
TARGETED OUTCOMES
TARGETED OUTCOME(S): CAPACITY BUILDING: National CSOs/POs have increased capacity to influence the public and private sector on the right to food and to participate in more inclusive fertilizer, land and finance systems. TARGETED OUTCOME(S): POLICY CHANGE 1a) The Burundian government has implemented policies and practicesthat advance the opportunitiesof smallholder producers to access fertilizers, credits, land and organization in cooperatives. 1b) Microfinance institutions have implemented credit services and conditions that improve access to credit for small farmers
EARLY AND INTERMEDIATE OUTCOMES 1a) Improved Policies # Governments: Government implemented policies and practices that benefit small producers 1b) Improved Policies # Private Sector: Microfinance institutions have implement-ted credit services andterms that improve access to credit for small farmers 2) Strengthened Civil Society Organizations: CSOs, POs and federations of cooperatives are capable of influencing decision makers 4)Increased Citizens Voice: Partner CSOs/POs and members have increased use of media to influence public opinion and to inform and sensitize members 5) Stronger and wider alliances: CSOs/POs built more contacts <(>&<)> alliances with stakeholders 6) Shifted norms and attitudes: Producers aware of risk of loss of soil fertility/adopt good soil health measures
OXFAM'S PROJECT CONTRIBUTION The main contribution of Oxfam in this project is to support the planning, organization, control and steering the activities; capacity building of partners (administrative, technical and financial support); the compilation and analysis of reports and their submission toHQ; the MEAL and survey.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

legacy-data.name: project-name
legacy-data.value: SPD&D L&A CO BUR Support Right to Food
